remarks: Induction on the upper integers that start _after_ an integer ` M ` . The first four hypotheses give us the substitution instances we need; the last two are the basis and the induction step.  (Contributed by NM, 25-Jul-2005.)
statement:
uzind2.1 $e |- ( j = ( M + 1 ) -> ( ph <-> ps ) ) $.
uzind2.2 $e |- ( j = k -> ( ph <-> ch ) ) $.
uzind2.3 $e |- ( j = ( k + 1 ) -> ( ph <-> th ) ) $.
uzind2.4 $e |- ( j = N -> ( ph <-> ta ) ) $.
uzind2.5 $e |- ( M e. ZZ -> ps ) $.
uzind2.6 $e |- ( ( M e. ZZ /\ k e. ZZ /\ M < k ) -> ( ch -> th ) ) $.
uzind2 $p |- ( ( M e. ZZ /\ N e. ZZ /\ M < N ) -> ta ) $.
$d M j k $.
$d N j $.
$d ch j $.
$d j ps $.
$d j ta $.
$d j th $.
$d k ph $.
